description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 9-13 November
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 9-13 November - BBC News
maintext:
Businesses are being asked to consider an alternative to the traditional Christmas office party due to coronavirus restrictions.
The Jersey Hospitality Association (JHA) is asking businesses to give their staff vouchers to support the hospitality sector.
This has been put in place due to the restrictions on numbers and types of entertainment allowed at venues due to the pandemic.
It is hoped this would be a way to support the hospitality and tourism businesses which have had a difficult year.
The offers include meals, nights in hotels and outdoor adventure experiences.
Simon Soar, chief executive of the JHA, said: "This has been a devastating year for trading in our sector, and while we have received financial support from the government, we only had a fraction of the visitors we would normally rely on."
